author: jwasinger
content:
We have an unspec'd edge-case around state reads and calls:

if a call is made which doesn't have enough gas to cover non-state-dependent costs (memory expansion, value transfer, EIP-2929 access costs), we won't record a read for the account in the access list.  However, if the target account has delegated to another and we have enough gas to cover all the call-related costs with the exception of the EIP-2929 access costs for resolving the delegated account code, what do we do?

I would say in this case, for the sake of consistency we should record the state access for the authority account but not the delegated account.

author: m0_ox
content: We have tests for this. There must be enough gas for all static checks and access cost and then there must be enough for the delegation warm / cold cost in order to actually have the delegation in the access list. Otherwise, only the authority is touched.

author: m0_ox
content: I believe [this PR](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/pull/1882) covers all of the CALL gas edge cases and was included in the last release.
